trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner"></xref> class provides signing functionality.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner"></xref> class by using a default subject identifier type.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner> class has the following default property values.
Property
Default value
1.3.14.3.2.26 (szOID_OIWSEC_sha1)

<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption.None> if <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignerIdentifierType%2A> is <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType>,
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption.ExcludeRoot> otherwise

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.CspParameters)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner"></xref> class with the specified cryptographic service provider (CSP) parameters.
<xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.CspParameters)"></xref> is useful when you know the specific CSP and private key to use for signing.
For the default property values used with this constructor, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.%23ctor>.

An exception to those values when this constructor is used is that <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption%2A> is set to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CspParameters"></xref> object that represents the set of CSP parameters to use.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner"></xref> class with the specified subject identifier type.
A member of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the signer identifier type.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner"></xref> class with the specified signing certificate.
For the default property values used with this constructor, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.%23ctor>.
The signing certificate specified by the `certificate` parameter is not checked for validity on input.
To validate the certificate prior to supplying it to this constructor, use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain.Build%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object that represents the signing certificate.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner"></xref> class with the specified signer identifier type and signing certificate.
The signing certificate specified by the `certificate` parameter is not checked for validity on input.
To validate the certificate prior to supplying it to this constructor, use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain.Build%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
A member of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the signer identifier type.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object that represents the signing certificate.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.Certificate"></xref> property sets or retrieves the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object that represents the signing certificate.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> object that represents the signing certificate.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.Certificates"></xref> property retrieves the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> collection that contains certificates associated with the message to be signed.
This property may be used to hold certificates in the signer's certificate chain.
In this case, the certificates included in the collection are determined by the setting of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption%2A> property.
Not all certificates in the signer's certificate chain are necessarily present in <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.Certificates%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> collection that represents the collection of certificates associated with the message to be signed.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.DigestAlgorithm"></xref> property sets or retrieves the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> that represents the hash algorithm used with the signature.
For the default value of this property, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.%23ctor>.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Oid"></xref> object that represents the hash algorithm used with the signature.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption"></xref> property sets or retrieves the option that controls whether the root and entire chain associated with the signing certificate are included with the created CMS/PKCS #7 message.

A member of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption"></xref> enumeration that specifies how much of the X509 certificate chain should be included in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner"></xref> object.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption"></xref> property can be one of the following <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption"></xref> members.
Name
Value
Meaning
The certificate chain is not included.
The certificate chain, except for the root certificate, is included.
Only the end certificate is included.
The certificate chain, including the root certificate, is included.
One of the arguments provided to a method was not valid.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignedAttributes"></xref> property retrieves the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection"></xref> collection of signed attributes to be associated with the resulting <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SignerInfo"></xref> content.
Signed attributes are signed along with the specified content.

An example of a signed attribute that might be included in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection> collection retrieved by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignedAttributes%2A> property is the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.Pkcs9SigningTime> signing time attribute.

A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.Pkcs9ContentType> object and a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.Pkcs9MessageDigest> object will be automatically generated and placed in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SignerInfo.SignedAttributes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property for the corresponding signer whenever the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignedAttributes%2A> property is not empty.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection"></xref> collection that represents the signed attributes.
If there are no signed attributes, the property is an empty collection.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignerIdentifierType"></xref> property sets or retrieves the type of the identifier of the signer.
A member of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the type of the identifier of the signer.
One of the arguments provided to a method was not valid.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.UnsignedAttributes"></xref> property retrieves the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection"></xref> collection of unsigned PKCS #9 attributes to be associated with the resulting <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SignerInfo"></xref> content.
Unsigned attributes can be modified without invalidating the signature.

An example of an unsigned attribute that might be included in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection> collection retrieved by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.UnsignedAttributes%2A> property is a countersignature.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection"></xref> collection that represents the unsigned attributes.
If there are no unsigned attributes, the property is an empty collection.
